Steam (ST): ...Rosa and the rest returned from the chapel to the parlor in the mansion. So many things had happened since early in the morning. Of course they were high-strung...
Umineko Project (UP): ...Rosa and the rest returned from the chapel to the parlor in the mansion.{n}Such a horrific thing had happened so early in the morning.{n}Of course they were high‐strung...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Rosa and the rest returned from the chapel to the parlor in the mansion. So many things had happened since early in the morning. Of course they were high-strung...
PC Japanese (JP): …楼座たちは礼拝堂から屋敷の客間に戻っていた。早朝からあれだけのことがあったのだ。神経が参らないわけもない…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …楼座たちは礼拝堂から屋敷の客間に戻っていた。{n}早朝からあれだけのことがあったのだ。{n}神経が参らないわけもない…。
Russian (RU): ...Роза и остальные вернулись из часовни в гостиную особняка.{n}Так много событий произошло с утра пораньше.{n}Естественно, они были напряжены...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Rosa e os outros retornaram da capela para a sala de visitas da mansão.{n}Tal coisa horrível havia acabado de acontecer tão cedo essa manhã.{n}É claro, eles estavam muito nervosos...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …樓座一行人從禮拜堂回到了大屋的客廳。{n}一大早就發生了那樣的事情。{n}精神不可能承受得了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …楼座一行人从礼拜堂回到了大屋的客厅。{n}一大早就发生了那样的事情。{n}精神不可能承受得了…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Rosa e gli altri tornarono dalla cappella al salone, nella villa. Erano accadute tantissime cose, sin dalle prime ore del mattino. Ovviamente erano tutti nervosi...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Dalla cappella, Rosa e gli altri ritornarono al salotto della villa.{n}Si erano svolti così tanti eventi sin dalle prime ore del mattino.{n}Non c'era da stupirsi se fossero con i nervi tesi...
Turkish (TR): ...Rosa ve diğerleri kiliseden dönüp salona geldiler.{n}Sabahın bu erken saatinde böylesine korkunç bir şey olmuştu.{n}Doğal olarak çok gergindiler...

Steam (ST): Battler and George, who had cried, raged, and let their emotions explode after seeing their parents' tragic bodies, returned to the parlor and sat in the sofas, dazed, as though everything up until then had been a lie...
Umineko Project (UP): Battler and George—who had cried, raged, and let their emotions explode after seeing their parents' tragic bodies—returned to the parlor, sat on the sofas, and let their minds go blank, as though everything up until then had been a lie...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Battler and George, who had cried, raged, and let their emotions explode after seeing their parents' tragic bodies, returned to the parlor and sat in the sofas, dazed, as though everything up until then had been a lie...
PC Japanese (JP): 両親たちの惨たらしい姿を見て、泣いたり激怒したりと感情を破裂させていた戦人と譲治は、客間に戻りソファーに腰掛けると、それまでが嘘だったように放心するのだった…。
Russian (RU): Баттлер и Джордж, которые кричали, бушевали, и не сдерживали своих эмоций, после того как увидели мёртвые тела своих родителей, вернулись в гостиную и рухнули на диван, ошарашенные, как будто всё случившееся ранее, не могло быть правдой...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler e George — que choraram, se irritaram, e deixaram suas emoções explodirem ao ver o trágico estado dos corpos de seus pais — retornaram à sala de visitas, sentaram no sofá e deixaram suas mentes em branco, como se tudo até então fosse apenas uma mentira...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 目睹了雙親的慘狀，又是嚎哭又是狂怒地任由情緒爆發過的戰人與讓治，一回到客廳坐倒在沙發上，就猶如之前的一切都是謊言一般，恍惚著發起了呆…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 目睹了双亲的惨状，又是嚎哭又是狂怒地任由情绪爆发过的战人与让治，一回到客厅坐倒在沙发上，就犹如之前的一切都是谎言一般，恍惚着发起了呆…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Battler e George, che avevano pianto, gridato, e lasciato esplodere le loro emozioni dopo aver visto i corpi dei loro genitori, tornarono nel salone e si sedettero sui divani, storditi, come se tutto ciò che era successo fosse stata solo una bugia...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Battler e George, che alla vista dello stato pietoso dei loro genitori erano esplosi in una tempesta di lacrime e rabbia, tornarono nel salotto e si sedettero con aria assente sul divano, come se quanto avvenuto finora non fosse mai successo...
Turkish (TR): Ailelerinin trajik bedenlerini gördüklerinde gözyaşlarına boğulan, öfkelenen ve içlerindeki duyguların patlamasına izin veren Battler ve George salona geri döndüler, koltuklara oturdular ve sanki o ana kadar her şey bir rüyadan ibaretmiş gibi zihinlerinin bulanıklaşmasına izin verdiler...

Steam (ST): Only Maria was completely unchanged and looked just like normal.
Umineko Project (UP): Only Maria was completely unchanged, and looked just like normal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only Maria was completely unchanged, and looked just like normal.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞だけはまったく変わらず普段通りに見えた。
Russian (RU): Лишь Мария не изменилась и выглядела абсолютно нормальной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas Maria não estava transtornada, e parecia normal como sempre.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只有真里亞看起來還是和往常一模一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只有真里亚看起来还是和往常一模一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Solo Maria rimase la stessa, e sembrava normale.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Solo Maria era rimasta completamente immutata rispetto al solito...
Turkish (TR): Yalnızca Maria hiç değişmemişti ve tamamen normal görünüyordu.

Steam (ST): ...When she wasn't playing pranks, she was basically a kid who played wordlessly by herself, so even if she was dazed, she would probably look just as she did.
Umineko Project (UP): ......When she wasn't being mischievous, she was basically a kid who played wordlessly by herself, so even if her mind was blank, she would probably look as she did.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......When she wasn't playing pranks, she was basically a kid who played wordlessly by herself, so even if she was dazed, she would probably look as she did.
PC Japanese (JP): ……悪ふざけをしていない時は、基本的に無口でひとりで遊んでいる子だから、仮に放心していたとしても、そう見えてしまうのかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ......Когда она не шалила, то была обычным ребёнком, игравшимся самим по себе, поэтому даже если она и была ошарашена, то, возможно, держала это в себе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quando ela não está sendo perniciosa, ela fisicamente é uma criança que brinca sozinha sem palavras, por isso, mesmo que sua mente estivesse em branco, ela provavelmente pareceria da mesma forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……畢竟在不淘氣的時候，她基本上都是默不作聲地一個人自娛自樂的，所以沒准，即便她是在恍惚著發呆，看起來也會是這樣吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……毕竟在不淘气的时候，她基本上都是默不作声地一个人自娱自乐的，所以没准，即便她是在恍惚着发呆，看起来也会是这样吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quando non faceva scherzi, non era altro che una bambina che giocava silenziosamente per conto suo, perciò anche se era stordita, probabilmente sembrava solo che stesse giocando.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando non combinava scherzi, era fondamentalmente una bambina che giocava in silenzio per conto suo, perciò anche se si fosse persa nei suoi pensieri, probabilmente avrebbe avuto lo stesso aspetto...
Turkish (TR): ......Yaramazlık yapmadığı zamanlarda, aslında kendi kendine sessiz sakin oynayabilen bir çocuktu, bu yüzden zihni boş olsa bile muhtemelen normalde olduğu gibi görünürdü.

Steam (ST): ...But as she turned on the TV and flipped through the channels, it looked as though nothing about her had changed from normal.
Umineko Project (UP): ...But as she turned on the TV and flipped through the channels, it looked as though nothing about her had changed from normal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …でも、テレビをつけてチャンネルをいじるその様子は、普段と何も変わらないように見えた。
Russian (RU): ...Но даже когда она включила телевизор и начала переключать каналы, она по‐прежнему выглядела так, будто в ней совсем ничего не изменилось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mas quando ela ligou a televisão e começou a passar pelos canais, pareceu como se nada tivesse mudado do normal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，她這副打開電視機換著頻道的樣子，看起來與平時沒有一絲一毫的區別。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，她这副打开电视机换着频道的样子，看起来与平时没有一丝一毫的区别。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma non appena si voltò verso la TV e cambiò i canali, sembrò che niente fosse mutato in lei.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma guardandola accendere la TV e girare tra i vari canali, sembrava non aver subito alcun cambiamento.
Turkish (TR): ...Ama televizyonu açıp kanallarda gezerken, onunla ilgili hiçbir şey normalden farklı değilmiş gibi görünüyordu.

Steam (ST): Did Rosa think anything in particular about this attitude, which was clearly different from normal people?
Umineko Project (UP): Perhaps Rosa had some opinions about this attitude, which was clearly different from normal people.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Did Rosa think anything in particular about this attitude, which was clearly different from normal people?
PC Japanese (JP): そんな、明らかに普通の人と違うセンスに、楼座は何か思うところがあるのだろうか。
Russian (RU): Приходили ли в голову Розе какие‐либо мысли насчет подобного поведения, столь очевидно отличавшегося от поведения нормальных людей?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apesar de Rosa ter algumas opiniões sobre essa atitude, que era claramente diferente de uma pessoa normal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這完全異於普通人的感覺，是讓樓座想到了什麼嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这完全异于普通人的感觉，是让楼座想到了什么吗？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa aveva pensato qualcosa in particolare riguardo quell'atteggiamento, che era chiaramente diverso da quello di una persona normale?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa pareva avere qualcosa da ridire sulla sua condotta, chiaramente diversa da quella che una persona normalmente manterrebbe...
Turkish (TR): Normal insanlardan açıkça farklı olan bu tutum hakkında Rosa'nın muhtemelen bazı düşünceleri vardı.

Steam (ST): ...She stared at Maria's back as though looking at something that wasn't quite heartwarming.
Umineko Project (UP): ......She stared at Maria's back with a gaze that wasn't quite pleasant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……微笑ましいのとは少し違う眼差しで、彼女はじっとその背中を見ているのだった。
Russian (RU): ......Она уставилась на спину Марии довольно неприятным взглядом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela olhou para as costas de Maria com um olhar que não era nada agradável.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……她以一副稍稍不同於欣慰的眼神，凝視著真里亞的背影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……她以一副稍稍不同于欣慰的眼神，凝视着真里亚的背影。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Fissò la schiena di Maria con uno sguardo che non era certo piacevole.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Le stava fissando la schiena con uno sguardo non esattamente amorevole.
Turkish (TR): ......Maria'nın sırtına pek de hoş olmayan bir bakışla baktı.

Steam (ST): Eventually, Kumasawa came to say good morning. ...Her cheerful manner was clearly out of place, and she couldn't help but be bewildered by the strange atmosphere in the room.
Umineko Project (UP): Eventually, Kumasawa came to say good morning. ...Her cheerful manner was clearly out of place, and she couldn't help but be bewildered at the strange atmosphere in the room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eventually, Kumasawa came to say good morning....Her cheerful manner was clearly out of place, and she couldn't help but be bewildered at the strange atmosphere in the room.
PC Japanese (JP): やがて、熊沢がやって来て朝の挨拶をした。…その朗らかな様子は明らかに場違いで、彼女は客間の異様な雰囲気に面食らわずにはいられなかった。
Russian (RU): В конце концов, Кумасава пришла сказать доброе утро. ...Её бодрый нрав был абсолютно не к месту, и она неизбежно оказалась озадачена странной атмосферой в комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eventualmente, Kumasawa apareceu para dizer bom‐dia. ...Suas animadas maneiras claramente estavam fora de lugar, e ela não podia fazer nada além de ficar perplexa com a atmosfera que estava na sala.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 過了一會兒，熊澤進來向大家道了早安。…這副開朗的樣子顯然是不合時宜，客廳異樣的氣氛不由得使她感到了不知失措。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 过了一会儿，熊泽进来向大家道了早安。…这副开朗的样子显然是不合时宜，客厅异样的气氛不由得使她感到了不知失措。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Improvvisamente, Kumasawa arrivò per darci il buongiorno. ... I suoi modi allegri erano decisamente fuori luogo, e non poté che essere sconcertata dalla strana atmosfera nella sala.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ad un certo punto, Kumasawa giunse a dare il buongiorno... I suoi modi gioviali erano palesemente fuori luogo, e non potè fare a meno di essere colta alla sprovvista dalla strana atmosfera nel salotto...
Turkish (TR): Nihayet, Kumasawa günaydın demeye geldi. ...Neşeli tavrı açıkça yersizdi ve odadaki garip atmosfer karşısında şaşkınlığını gizleyemedi.

Steam (ST): ...Then, when she heard the details from Gohda, she reacted loudly with shock.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Then, she heard the details from Gohda, and expressed her shock in a truly noisy manner.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Then, she heard the details from Gohda, and was really noisy and shocked.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、郷田から経緯を聞き、実に騒がしく驚くのだった。
Russian (RU): ......Затем она услышала подробности от Годы, и стала по‐настоящему шумной от испытанного потрясения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Foi então que ela ouviu de Gohda os detalhes, e sua expressão de choque foi realmente barulhenta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而在聽鄉田講述了事情的原委後，她很是吵鬧地吃了一驚。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而在听乡田讲述了事情的原委后，她很是吵闹地吃了一惊。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Poi, quando venne informata dei dettagli da Gohda, fu molto rumorosa e rimase scioccata.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E quando venne informata dei dettagli da Gouda, fece un gran clamore per via del suo shock.
Turkish (TR): ......Daha sonrasında Gohda'dan ayrıntıları dinledi ve yaşadığı şoku gerçekten gürültülü bir şekilde dışa vurdu.

Speaker: Kumasawa Chiyo
Steam (ST): "O-O-O-Of course you've contacted the police, right...?! What should we do in a time like this, oooh, what should we do...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "O‐o‐o‐of course you've contacted the police, right...?! What should we do in a time like this, oooh, what should we do...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "O o o, of course you've contacted the police, right...?! What should we do in a time like this, oooh, what should we do...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ももも、もちろん警察には連絡したんですよね…？！　こういう時はどうすればいいんでしょう、おぉ、どうすればいいんでしょう…！」
Russian (RU): "К‐к‐к‐конечно вы же связались с полицией, ведь так?! Что нам делать в такой ситуации, о‐о‐ох, что же нам делать?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "V‐V‐V‐Vocês ligaram para a polícia, certo...?! O que devemos fazer em uma situação dessas, oooh, o que devemos fazer...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「當當當、當然是已經去聯絡過警察了吧…？！這種時候該怎麼辦才好呀，哦哦，該怎麼辦才好呀…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「当当当、当然是已经去联络过警察了吧…？！这种时候该怎么办才好呀，哦哦，该怎么办才好呀…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "O-O-Ovviamente avete contattato la polizia, giusto...?! Cosa dovremmo fare in una situazione simile, oooh, cosa dovremmo fare...?!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "O-O-O-Ovviamente avete contattato la polizia, vero...?! Cosa dovremmo fare in una situazione del genere, oooh, cosa dovremmo fare...?!"
Turkish (TR): "P-P-P-Polisle temasa geçtiniz, değil mi...?! Böyle bir zamanda ne yapmalıyız, oooh, ne yapmalıyız...?!"

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Steam (ST): "......Please calm down and listen. ...It seems a machine somewhere was somehow done in by lightning last night. Because of that, we haven't been able to use the phones..."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Please listen calmly. ...It seems that some kind of apparatus was done in by lightning last night. Because of that, we have become unable to use the telephones..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Please calm down and listen. ...It seems that a machine was somehow done in by lightning last night. Because of that, we haven't been able to use the phones..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………落ち着いて聞いてください。…どうも昨夜の落雷で何かの機械がやられたようなのです。それで電話が使えなくなっておりまして…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………落ち着いて聞いてください。…どうも昨夜の落雷で何かの機械がやられたようなのです。それで電話が使えなくなっておりまして…」
Russian (RU): ".........Пожалуйста, успокойтесь и послушайте. ...Кажется, ночью аппарат был как‐то повреждён молнией. Из‐за этого мы не смогли воспользоваться телефонами..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Por favor, ouça calmamente. ...Parece que o aparelho quebrou noite passada por causa de um raio. Por causa disso, estamos incapazes de usar o telefone..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………請冷靜下來聽鄙人說。…昨晚的落雷好像是擊壞了什麼機器。因此電話不能使用了…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………请冷静下来听鄙人说。…昨晚的落雷好像是击坏了什么机器。因此电话不能使用了…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Per favore calmati e ascolta. ... Sembra che la centralina sia stata distrutta in qualche modo da un fulmine la scorsa notte. E a causa di questo, non siamo stati capaci di usare i telefoni..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Calmati e ascoltami, per favore... Sembra che ieri sera i fulmini abbiano messo fuori uso qualche meccanismo. E dunque non abbiamo potuto usare i telefoni..."
Turkish (TR): ".........Lütfen sakince dinleyin. ...Görünüşe göre dün gece bir tür cihaza yıldırım düşmüş. Bu yüzden telefonları kullanamıyoruz..."

Speaker: Kumasawa Chiyo
Steam (ST): "Whaaaat?!! Th-Then, until the typhoon passes, we can't even contact the police?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Huuuh?!! Th‐then, until the typhoon passes, we can't even contact the police?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Eeeehhh!! Th, then, until the typhoon passes, we can't even contact the police?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇえぇッ！！　じゃ、じゃあ台風が過ぎるまで、警察にも連絡できないんですか？！」
Russian (RU): "Э?! Т‐тогда до того как тайфун пройдет, мы даже не сможем связаться с полицией?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ehhhh?! E‐Então, até o tufão passar, não podemos nem entrar em contato com a polícia!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哎哎哎哎！！那、那在台风过去之前，是连警察都联络不上了吗？！」

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Eeeeeh?!! Q-Quindi, finché il tifone non passerà, non potremo neanche contattare la polizia?!"
Turkish (TR): "Heeeh?!! O-O zaman, tayfun geçene kadar polise bile ulaşamayacak mıyız?!"

Steam (ST): Maybe Kumasawa's exaggerated surprise was a little comical.
Umineko Project (UP): Maybe Kumasawa's exaggerated surprise was a little comical.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 熊沢の大袈裟な驚き方が少しだけ滑稽だったのかもしれない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez a surpresa exagerada de Kumasawa tenha sido um pouco cômica.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 熊泽那夸张的吃惊方式，或许是有一点点滑稽吧。

Steam (ST): Even in this kind of situation, Rosa giggled.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa giggled, in spite of the situation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even in this kind of situation, Rosa giggled.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座はこんな状況にもかかわらず、くすりと笑ってしまう。
Russian (RU): Даже в такой ситуации Роза хихикнула.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa riu, apesar da situação.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "......I've got to stay strong. ...It's not just Maria. I'm acting as a parent for George-kun and Battler-kun too, so I have to stay strong..."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I've got to stay strong. ......It's not just Maria. ......I'm acting as a parent for George‐kun and Battler‐kun too now, so I have to stay strong......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........I've got to stay strong. ......It's not just Maria. I'm acting as a parent for George-kun and Battler-kun too, so I have to stay strong......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………私がしっかりしなきゃ。……真里亞だけじゃない。……譲治くんも戦人くんも、今は私が親代わりなんだから、しっかりしなきゃいけない……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………私がしっかりしなきゃ。……真里亞だけじゃない。……譲治くんも戦人くんも、今は私が親代わりなんだから、しっかりしなきゃいけない……」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu tenho que me manter forte. ......Não é apenas a Maria. ......Eu estou agindo como uma mãe para o George‐kun e o Battler‐kun também, então preciso ficar forte......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我必須振作起來才行。……不僅僅是真里亞。……就連讓治君和戰人君，現在也要由我來代他們的父母照料，所以我必須振作起來才行……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我必须振作起来才行。……不仅仅是真里亚。……就连让治君和战人君，现在也要由我来代他们的父母照料，所以我必须振作起来才行……」

Steam (ST): Rosa had been the youngest sibling, with a large difference in age between her and the others. So, she had always been treated as a child.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa had been the youngest sibling, with a large difference in age between her and the others.{n}So she was always treated as a child.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa had been the youngest sibling, with a large difference in age between her and the others. So she was always treated as a child.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は、他の兄弟から大きく歳の差のある末っ子だった。だからいつも子ども扱いだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座は、他の兄弟から大きく歳の差のある末っ子だった。{n}だからいつも子ども扱いだった。
Russian (RU): Роза была младшим ребёнком в семье с большой разницей в возрасте с остальными.{n}Поэтому к ней всегда обращались как к ребёнку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa era a mais nova, com uma larga diferença de idade em relação aos seus irmãos. Por isso, ela sempre foi tratada como criança.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座是與其他哥哥姐姐年歲相差很大的小女兒。{n}所以一直都被當成小孩子看待。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座是与其他哥哥姐姐年岁相差很大的小女儿。{n}所以一直都被当成小孩子看待。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa era la sorella minore, con una differenza enorme d'età fra lei e gli altri. Perciò veniva sempre trattata come una bambina.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa era la figlia più piccola, con un'enorme differenza d'età fra lei e gli altri fratelli.{n}Perciò veniva sempre trattata come una bambina.
Turkish (TR): Rosa en küçük kardeşti ve diğer kardeşleriyle arasında büyük bir yaş farkı vardı.{n}Bu yüzden ona her zaman çocuk muamelesi yapılmıştı.

Steam (ST): Every time she learned something new, it was something obvious to her siblings, and she had built up a complex, becoming convinced of her own incompetence.
Umineko Project (UP): Every time she learned something new, it was something obvious to her brothers and sister, and she had grown a complex, thinking that she must be incompetent.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Every time she learned something new, it was something obvious to her brothers and sister, and she had grown a complex, thinking that she must be incompetent.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分が新しく覚えたことは、いつも兄や姉たちにとって当り前のことで、自分が無能に違いないとコンプレックスを抱いてきた。
Russian (RU): Всё, что она узнавала, было очевидным для её братьев и сестры, и у неё образовался комплекс от мысли, что она, должно быть, недостаточно способна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Toda vez que ela aprendia algo novo, era algo óbvio para seus irmãos e irmã, e ela cresceu com um complexo, pensando que era incompetente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她新學到的東西，對哥哥姐姐們來說總是很稀鬆平常的事情，而她也認定了自己很無能，從小到大都懷有自卑情緒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她新学到的东西，对哥哥姐姐们来说总是很稀松平常的事情，而她也认定了自己很无能，从小到大都怀有自卑情绪。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ogni volta che imparava qualcosa di nuovo, quel qualcosa era ovvio ai suoi fratelli e a sua sorella, così coltivò dei complessi, pensando che doveva essere incompetente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ogni volta che imparava qualcosa di nuovo, i suoi fratelli e sua sorella la trovavano ovvia, e sviluppò dei complessi, convincendosi di essere una buona a nulla.
Turkish (TR): Ne zaman yeni bir şey öğrense, bu her zaman kardeşlerinin bildiği bir şey oluyordu, ve bu yüzden kendisinin beceriksiz olduğunu düşünmeye başlayarak bir kompleks edinmişti.

Steam (ST): So, she had developed a passive personality, asking her siblings for advice every time something happened...
Umineko Project (UP): So she had formed a passive attitude, asking her brothers and sister for advice every time something happened...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So she had formed a passive attitude, asking her brothers and sister for advice every time something happened...
PC Japanese (JP): そのため、何かある度に兄や姉たちに指示を乞う受身な体質になってしまっていた…。
Russian (RU): Поэтому у неё сформировалась привычка просить совет у братьев и сестры при каждом происшествии...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso ela desenvolveu uma atitude passiva, pedindo aos seus irmãos e irmã por conselhos toda vez que algo acontecia...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，她養成了一種每當有什麼事，都會想去請示哥哥姐姐的被動性格…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，她养成了一种每当有什么事，都会想去请示哥哥姐姐的被动性格…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò si è formato in lei un atteggiamento passivo, che la spingeva a chiedere consiglio ai suoi fratelli e a sua sorella ogni volta che accadeva qualcosa...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò acquisì una disposizione passiva, che la spingeva a chiedere consigli ai suoi fratelli e a sua sorella ogni volta che succedeva qualcosa...
Turkish (TR): Bu yüzden pasif bir tavrı vardı ve ne zaman bir şey olsa ağabeylerinden ve ablalarından tavsiyeler istiyordu...

Steam (ST): ......But she no longer had any brothers or sisters. Now, Rosa was the only one of the four Ushiromiya siblings left.
Umineko Project (UP): .........But she no longer had any brothers or sisters.{n}Now, Rosa was the only one of the four Ushiromiya siblings left.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........But she no longer had any brothers or sisters. Now, Rosa was the only one of the four Ushiromiya siblings left.
PC Japanese (JP): ………しかし、もう兄も姉もいない。今や右代宮４兄弟は楼座ひとり。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Furthermore, if Kinzo continued to shut himself away even in this extraordinary situation, ......Rosa would have to surpass this crisis as the representative of the head.

Russian (RU): ...Кроме того, если Кинзо по‐прежнему оставался у себя взаперти даже в такой чрезвычайной ситуации... Роза должна была преодолеть эту напасть в качестве представителя главы.

Steam (ST): ...She had a good guess at what was going on. He was probably yelling something nonsensical again and becoming unmanagable.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...She had a general guess. He was probably yelling about something nonsensical again, unable to control himself.
PC Japanese (JP): …大方想像はつく。また何か支離滅裂なことを怒鳴りだし、収拾が付かなくなっているのだろう。
Russian (RU): ...В целом, она могла представить, что из этого последует. Он, должно быть, кричал какую‐нибудь бессмыслицу в порыве неконтролируемых эмоций.

Umineko Project (UP): She had planned on using the extension phone to call the study, but with the telephone line dead, there was nothing else for it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had planned on using the extension phone to call the study, but unfortunately, the phones were broken.
PC Japanese (JP): 内線電話で書斎に電話をしようと思ったのが、電話が故障では仕方がない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 内線電話で書斎に電話をしようと思ったが、電話が故障では仕方がない。
Russian (RU): Она хотела воспользоваться запасным телефоном, чтобы позвонить в кабинет, но к сожалению и этот телефон оказался сломан.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela tinha planejado usar a extensão do telefone para ligar para o estúdio, mas, com a linha do telefone estando morta, não havia mais o que se fazer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然她本想用內線電話打給書房，但既然電話故障了，那就沒有辦法了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然她本想用内线电话打给书房，但既然电话故障了，那就没有办法了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Aveva pianificato di usare il telefono per chiamare lo studio, ma sfortunatamente, la linea era guasta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Aveva pensato di chiamare lo studio con il telefono interno, ma con la linea guasta non c'era nulla da fare.
Turkish (TR): Çalışma odasını aramak için dahili telefonu kullanmayı düşünmüştü ama telefon hattı arızalı olduğu için yapacak başka bir şey yoktu.

Steam (ST): Rosa decided to go to the study directly, with her own two feet.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa decided to go to the study directly, with her own two feet.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa decided to go to the study directly, with her own two feet.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は自分の足で書斎に直接、赴くことにする。
Russian (RU): Тогда Роза решила лично сходить в кабинет её отца.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa decidiu ir diretamente ao estúdio, com seus dois pés.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座決定直接親自去一趟書房。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座决定直接亲自去一趟书房。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa decise di dirigersi allo studio direttamente, coi suoi stessi piedi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa decise di dirigersi allo studio di persona, con le sue stesse gambe.
Turkish (TR): Rosa kendi ayaklarıyla doğrudan çalışma odasına gitmeye karar verdi.

Steam (ST): Her old self would've been too frightened to go see Kinzo.
Umineko Project (UP): Her old self would have been so frightened that she wouldn't have been able to go see Kinzo.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her old self would be so frightened that she wouldn't have been able to go see Kinzo.
PC Japanese (JP): かつての自分なら、金蔵のところへ行くなんて、恐ろしくてできない。
Russian (RU): Прежняя она настолько бы испугалась, что никак не решилась бы отправиться туда, чтобы увидеться с Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu antigo "eu" estaria tão apavorado que ela não seria capaz de ir ver Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果是過去的自己，那肯定是會怕得不敢去金藏那裡的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果是过去的自己，那肯定是会怕得不敢去金藏那里的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La vecchia Rosa sarebbe stata talmente impaurita da non essere capace di andare a parlare con Kinzo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La se stessa di un tempo sarebbe stata così spaventata all'idea di recarsi da Kinzo, che vi avrebbe rinunciato...
Turkish (TR): Eskiden olsa o kadar korkardı ki Kinzo'yu görmeye gidemezdi.

Steam (ST): ...And in fact, if she did meet him, she would probably be blamed somehow and insulted.
Umineko Project (UP): ...And in fact, if she did meet him, she would probably be blamed for something and abused.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If she actually met him, she would probably be blamed for something and abused.
PC Japanese (JP): …実際、会えば何か難癖を付けられて罵られるだろう。
Russian (RU): ...Встреться она с ним и в самом деле, то её, скорее всего, в чём‐нибудь обвинят и жестоко накажут.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...De fato, se ela se reencontrasse com Kinzo, ele provavelmente a culparia de algo e abusaria dela verbalmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …真與他見了面，估計是會被他找出些什麼岔子，大罵一頓的吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …真与他见了面，估计是会被他找出些什么岔子，大骂一顿的吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Se l'avesse incontrato, probabilmente sarebbe stata sgridata per qualcosa e maltrattata.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E infatti, se l'avesse incontrato, lui l'avrebbe rimproverata per qualcosa, per poi lanciarle contro insulti.
Turkish (TR): ...Ve aslında, eğer onunla tanışırsa, muhtemelen bir şey için suçlanacak ve aşağılanacaktı.

Steam (ST): But this was no time to be frightened. ......As his true daughter, she had to make him aware of the current situation.
Umineko Project (UP): But now wasn't the time to be frightened. .........As his true daughter, she had to make him aware of the current situation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But now wasn't a time to be frightened..........As his true daughter, she had to make him aware of the current situation.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし今は恐れている場合じゃない。………実の娘の自分が、現状を伝え認識させなければならないのだ。
Russian (RU): Но сейчас не время, чтобы бояться. .........Как его истинная дочь, она обязана была доложить ему о текущей ситуации.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas agora não era hora para ficar apavorada. .........Como sua legítima filha, ela precisava deixá‐lo ciente da atual situação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但現在不是害怕的時候了。………身為親生女兒的自己，必須去告訴他實情，讓他認清現狀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但现在不是害怕的时候了。………身为亲生女儿的自己，必须去告诉他实情，让他认清现状。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma quello non era il momento per essere impauriti. ... In qualità di sua figlia, aveva l'obbligo di renderlo consapevole della situazione.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma quello non era il momento per essere impauriti... In qualità di sua figlia di sangue, aveva il dovere di informarlo delle circostanze.
Turkish (TR): Ama şimdi korkmanın sırası değildi. .........Onun gerçek bir kızı olarak, mevcut durumdan onu haberdar etmeliydi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "...Kumasawa-san, I'm going to see Father. ...Take special care of George-kun and Battler-kun. ...I'm sure they're on edge right now."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Kumasawa‐san, I'm going to see Father. ...Take special care of George‐kun and Battler‐kun. ......I'm sure they are on edge right now."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Kumasawa-san, I'm going to see Father. ...Take special care of George-kun and Battler-kun. ......I believe they are surely on edge right now."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……熊沢さん。私はお父様のところへ行ってきます。…特に譲治くんと戦人くんの二人をお願いします。……きっとだいぶ神経が参ってると思うの。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……熊沢さん。私はお父様のところへ行ってきます。…特に譲治くんと戦人くんの二人をお願いします。……きっとだいぶ神経が参ってると思うの」
Russian (RU): "......Кумасава‐сан, мне нужно увидеться с отцом. ...Особенно позаботься о Джордже‐куне и Баттлер‐куне. ......Я думаю, они сейчас на самой грани нервного срыва."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Kumasawa‐san, eu estou indo ver meu pai. ...Tome um cuidado especial com o George‐kun e o Battler‐kun. ......Tenho certeza que eles devem estar no limite agora."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……熊澤婆婆。我要去一趟爸那裡。…特別是讓治君和戰人君兩人，就拜託你照顧了。……我想，他們的精神肯定已經垮了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……熊泽婆婆。我要去一趟爸那里。…特别是让治君和战人君两人，就拜托你照顾了。……我想，他们的精神肯定已经垮了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Kumasawa-san, sto andando a parlare con mio Padre. ... Prenditi cura di George-kun e Battler-kun. ... Immagino siano molto spaventati al momento."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Kumasawa‐san. Sto andando a parlare con nostro padre... Si prenda cura in particolare di George-kun e Battler-kun... Sono sicura che siano molto provati."
Turkish (TR): "......Kumasawa-san, ben babamı görmeye gidiyorum. ...Lütfen, George-kun ve Battler-kun'a özel ilgi göster. ......Eminim şu anda çok diken üstündedirler."

Speaker: Kumasawa Chiyo
Steam (ST): "Yes, yes... That may be true... ...It is truly pitiable... I shall make them something warm to drink."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes, yes... I am quite sure they must be... ...It is truly pitiable... I shall make them something warm to drink."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes, yes... That may be true......It is truly pitiable.... I shall make them something warm to drink."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇえぇ…。それはそうでございましょうとも…。…本当にお気の毒なことです…。何か温かい飲み物でも作ってあげることにいたします。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇえぇ…。それはそうでございましょうとも…。…本当にお気の毒なことです…。何か温かい飲み物でも作ってあげることにいたします」
Russian (RU): "Да, да... Это очень возможно... ...Вот уж кого действительно жаль.... Я приготовлю им выпить чего‐нибудь горячего."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, sim... Eu também tenho certeza de que devem estar... ...É realmente lamentável... Eu irei preparar algo quente para eles beberem."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那當然，那當然…。想來確實是如您所說啊…。…真是太可怜了…。老太婆會做些暖暖的飲品給少爺們喝的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那当然，那当然…。想来确实是如您所说啊…。…真是太可怜了…。老太婆会做些暖暖的饮品给少爷们喝的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Certo, certo... potrebbe essere vero... è comprensibile... preparerò loro qualcosa di caldo da bere."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Certo, certo... Sono certa di sì... Quanto mi dispiace... Preparerò loro da bere qualcosa di caldo."
Turkish (TR): "Evet, evet... Öyle olduklarına eminim... ...Bu gerçekten içler acısı... Onlara içecek sıcak bir şeyler hazırlayayım."

Steam (ST): "Thank you."
Umineko Project (UP): "Thank you."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): [=ITA]

Steam (ST): Rosa went out into the hallway and headed towards Kinzo's study.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa went out into the hallway, and headed towards Kinzo's study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は廊下へ出て、金蔵の書斎へ向かう。
Russian (RU): Роза вышла в коридор и направилась в сторону кабинета Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa saiu para o corredor e foi em direção ao estúdio de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座來到走廊，向金藏的書房走去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座来到走廊，向金藏的书房走去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa andò verso il corridoio, e si diresse allo studio di Kinzo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa uscì nel corridoio, e andò in direzione dello studio di Kinzo.
Turkish (TR): Rosa koridora çıktı ve Kinzo'nun çalışma odasına doğru yöneldi.

Steam (ST): The atmosphere in this mansion, which she'd spent her younger days in and should've been full of memories, seemed somehow different...
Umineko Project (UP): The atmosphere in this mansion, which she had spent her younger days in and should have been full of memories, seemed somehow different...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The atmosphere in this mansion, which she had spent her younger days in and should have been full of memories, seemed somehow different...
PC Japanese (JP): 少女時代を過ごし、たくさんの思い出が詰まったはずの屋敷の空気が、どこか違っているような気がした…。
Russian (RU): Атмосфера в этом особняке, в котором она провела свою юность и который был полон воспоминаний, казалась совсем иной...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A atmosfera daquela mansão, a qual ela passou seus dias de infância e deveria estar repleta de memórias, parecia diferente de alguma forma...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這裡明明應該是自己度過了少女時代，充滿了種種回憶的大屋。但總感覺其中的空氣，哪裡有些不同…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这里明明应该是自己度过了少女时代，充满了种种回忆的大屋。但总感觉其中的空气，哪里有些不同…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): L'atmosfera in questa villa, in cui aveva speso gli anni della sua giovinezza e che sarebbe dovuta essere ricca di ricordi, sembrava in qualche modo diversa...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): L'atmosfera della villa, in cui aveva speso gli anni della sua giovinezza e che avrebbe dovuto sommergerla di ricordi, sembrava in qualche modo diversa...
Turkish (TR): Gençlik günlerini geçirdiği ve anılarla dolu olması gereken bu malikanenin atmosferi bir nedenden dolayı kendisine farklı geliyordu...

Steam (ST): She began to climb the stairs in the entrance hall...
Umineko Project (UP): And she began to climb the stairs in the entrance hall...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then she began to climb the stairs in the entrance hall...
PC Japanese (JP): そして玄関ホールの階段を登っていく…。
Russian (RU): Затем она стала подниматься по лестнице в вестибюле...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela começou a subir as escadas do hall de entrada...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，她走上門廳的樓梯…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，她走上门厅的楼梯…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi cominciò a salire le scale nell'atrio...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopodiché, iniziò a percorrere le scale del salone d'ingresso...
Turkish (TR): Ve girişteki merdivenleri çıkmaya başladı...

Steam (ST): ...Just then. In the faint darkness down the stairs behind Rosa's back, ...something glowed.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Just then. In the gloom down the stairs behind Rosa, ...something glowed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Just then. In the thin darkness down the stairs behind Rosa's back, ...something glowed.
PC Japanese (JP): ……その時。楼座が背中を向ける階下のホールの薄暗闇で、…何かが光った。
Russian (RU): ......И вдруг. В тонкой тьме вниз по ступенькам за спиной Розы... что‐то засияло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Naquele momento. Na escuridão atrás de Rosa, ...algo brilhou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……正在此時。樓座背對著的樓下門廳的陰暗處，…有什麼東西發出了光芒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……正在此时。楼座背对着的楼下门厅的阴暗处，…有什么东西发出了光芒。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Proprio allora accadde. Nell'ombra sottile al di sotto delle scale e dietro la schiena di Rosa... brillò qualcosa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E in quel momento... dietro alla schiena di Rosa, nella cupa oscurità del salone al piano terra... brillava qualcosa.
Turkish (TR): ......Tam o sırada. Rosa'nın arkasında, merdivenlerin aşağısındaki karanlıkta, ...bir şey parıldadı.

Steam (ST): It was a single, fluttering gold butterfly. ...It fluttered around and sparkled. That butterfly danced about without a sound.
Umineko Project (UP): It was a single fluttering gold butterfly.{n}...It fluttered around and sparkled.{n}That butterfly quietly danced without a sound.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was a single fluttering gold butterfly....It fluttered around and sparkled. That butterfly quietly danced without a sound.
PC Japanese (JP): それはひらひらと舞う、一匹の黄金の蝶。…ひらひらと舞い、ちかちかと輝く。その蝶は、音もなく静かに舞う。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それはひらひらと舞う、一匹の黄金の蝶。{n}…ひらひらと舞い、ちかちかと輝く。{n}その蝶は、音もなく静かに舞う。
Russian (RU): Это была одиноко порхающая золотая бабочка.{n}...Она порхала вокруг и сверкала.{n}Эта бабочка беззвучно плясала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era uma única e cintilante borboleta dourada.{n}...Estava agitada, dançando enquanto brilhava.{n}Aquele borboleta dançava sem fazer um único som.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是一只翩翩起舞的，黃金的蝴蝶。{n}…翩翩起舞，閃閃發光。{n}這只蝴蝶，悄無聲息地飛舞著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是一只翩翩起舞的，黄金的蝴蝶。{n}…翩翩起舞，闪闪发光。{n}这只蝴蝶，悄无声息地飞舞着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era una singola e svolazzante farfalla dorata. ... Svolazzava lì intorno e brillava. Quella farfalla danzava pacatamente senza fare rumore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era una farfalla dorata, che stava sbattendo le proprie ali...{n}Svolazzava nell'aria, emanando il suo luccichio.{n}La farfalla volteggiava silenziosamente, senza fare alcun rumore...
Turkish (TR): Bir altın kelebeğin kanat çırpışıydı.{n}...Etrafta kanat çırptı ve parıldadı.{n}Kelebek sessiz bir şekilde dans ediyordu.

Steam (ST): ...It was only natural. No one can hear the sound of a butterfly's wings beating.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Obviously. No one can hear the sound of a butterfly's wings beating.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……当然だ。蝶が羽ばたく音など聞こえるわけもない。
Russian (RU): ......Не таясь. Никто не может услышать звук биения крыльев бабочки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É claro. Ninguém seria capaz de ouvir o som das asas de uma borboleta batendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這是當然的。蝴蝶扇動翅膀的聲音本來就不可能聽得到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这是当然的。蝴蝶扇动翅膀的声音本来就不可能听得到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ovviamente. Nessuno potrebbe sentire il suono di un'ala di farfalla che sbatte.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era normale. Nessuno riuscirebbe a sentire il battito d'ali di una farfalla...
Turkish (TR): ......Tabii ki. Kimse bir kelebeğin kanat çırpma sesini duyamaz.

Steam (ST): ......And then, ...it came to a rest on Rosa's back as she slowly climbed the stairs.
Umineko Project (UP): .........And then, ......it stopped on Rosa's back as she slowly climbed the stairs.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………そして階段をゆっくり登っていく楼座の背中に、……止まる。
Russian (RU): .........А затем... она села на спину медленно поднимающейся по ступенькам Розе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........E então, ......ela parou nas costas de Rosa enquanto ela lentamente subia as escadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………然後它停在了正在慢慢走上樓梯的，……樓座的背上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………然后它停在了正在慢慢走上楼梯的，……楼座的背上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... E in quel momento... si fermò sulla schiena di Rosa che lentamente salì le scale.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Successivamente, si fermò... sulla schiena di Rosa, la quale stava lentamente salendo le scale.
Turkish (TR): .........Ve sonra, ......merdivenleri yavaşça çıkmakta olan Rosa'nın sırtında durdu.

Steam (ST): Rosa didn't notice it. If someone not in-the-know saw it, they'd probably assume it was just single sheet of gold leaf in the shape of a butterfly that had been stuck there.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa didn't notice. And to an ignorant observer, it would probably have looked just as though a single sheet of gold leaf in the shape of a butterfly had gotten stuck there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa didn't notice. And even if someone who didn't know saw it, they probably wouldn't have seen anything but a single sheet of gold leaf in the shape of a butterfly which had been stuck there.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は気付かない。そして知らぬ者が見たとしても、蝶の形をした金箔が一枚、張り付いてるくらいにしか見えないだろう。
Russian (RU): Роза не заметила. И даже если бы кто‐то увидел её, они, вероятно, не увидели ничего, кроме прицепившегося одинокого золотого листка в форме бабочки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa não percebeu. E, para um observador ignorante, aquilo pareceria apenas uma única folha dourada na forma de uma borboleta que acabou ficando presa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座並沒有感覺到。就算被不知道這是什麼的人看見了，也只會以為是背後粘了張蝶形金箔吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座并没有感觉到。就算被不知道这是什么的人看见了，也只会以为是背后粘了张蝶形金箔吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa non se ne accorse. E anche se qualcuno che non lo sapeva l'avesse vista, probabilmente l'avrebbe scambiata per un pezzo di foglia dorata a forma di farfalla che era stata trasportata lì dentro.

PC Japanese (JP): この世のものと思えぬ惨状を見てきた者たちは、この今朝の出来事が全て夢であって欲しいと祈るかのように皆、無言を貫いていた。
Russian (RU): Все, кто видел ту таинственную и ужасную сцену, молчали, будто бы молясь, чтобы утренние события были лишь сном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cada uma daquelas pessoas que havia presenciado aquele terrível espetáculo permaneceu em silêncio, como se orassem para que todos aqueles eventos da manhã tivessem sido apenas um sonho.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tutti quelli che avevano visto quella scena orribile e sinistra restarono in silenzio, come se stessero pregando che gli eventi accaduti quella mattina fossero stati tutti un sogno.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……这么说来，那堆了三块的金块，就是展示给他们…又或者是展示给我们的东西了。……它是在告诉我们：黄金传说毫无疑问是存在的。并不是什么幻想。让我们快把它找出来看看。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler

Tanto per cominciare, i nostri genitori, che avrebbero potuto comprendere l'epigrafe meglio di chiunque altro, sono stati uccisi per primi.{n}Credo che ciò sia una contraddizione lampante..."

Russian (RU): "Мария, выключи телевизор. ......Генджи‐сан, пожалуйста скажите мне, где находится комната Джессики‐чан. Идём все вместе."

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Maria, spegni il televisore... Genji-san. Per favore, dimmi dov'è la stanza di Jessica-chan. Venite tutti."

Steam (ST): We stood up. Maria alone looked like she had some regrets about the TV, but she decided to go along with everyone for now and got up.
Umineko Project (UP): We stood up. Maria alone looked like she had some lingering attachment to the TV, but she went along with everyone for now, and got up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We stood up. Maria alone looked like she had some regrets about the TV, but she went along with everyone for now, and got up.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちは腰を上げる。真里亞だけはテレビに未練があるようだったが、みんなに合わせて一応、腰を上げた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós nos levantamos. A Maria parecia ter um persistente apego à TV, mas, por ora, ela se juntou a todos e se levantou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們都站起了身來。雖然真里亞似乎還捨不得電視，但她姑且還是配合著大家，站了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们都站起了身来。虽然真里亚似乎还舍不得电视，但她姑且还是配合着大家，站了起来。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ci alzammo in piedi. Soltanto Maria sembrava essere riluttante ad allontanarsi dalla TV, ma alla fine si alzò e si unì agli altri.

Speaker: Ushiromiya George

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Shannon, grazie al cielo. Ci avete messo tanto per tornare indietro, ero in pensiero."

Steam (ST): We headed for Jessica's room, with the armed Aunt Rosa and Genji-san in the lead.
Umineko Project (UP): We headed for Jessica's room, led by Genji‐san, and Auntie Rosa, holding the gun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We headed for Jessica's room, with Rosa oba-san, holding the gun, and Genji-san in the lead.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちは、銃を構えた楼座叔母さんと源次さんを先頭に、朱志香の部屋を目指した。
Russian (RU): Мы направились в комнату Джессики с тётей Розой, державшей ружьё, и Генджи‐саном во главе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós fomos para o quarto da Jessica, com o Genji‐san na frente, e a tia Rosa, segurando a arma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們由舉著槍的樓座姑母與源次領頭，向朱志香的房間走去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们由举着枪的楼座姑母与源次领头，向朱志香的房间走去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ci dirigemmo verso la stanza di Jessica, con Rosa oba-san, che teneva il fucile, e Genji-san al comando.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Con a capo della fila Genji-san e Rosa-san, la quale teneva pronto il fucile, ci dirigemmo verso la stanza di Jessica.
Turkish (TR): Genji-san ve silahı tutan Rosa Teyze'nin önderliğinde Jessica'nın odasına yöneldik.

Steam (ST): Jessica and Kanon-kun were a boy and a girl of about the same age. It'd sure be a shame if we barged in on them at a bad time...or at least that's what we'd be joking about normally.
Umineko Project (UP): Jessica and Kanon‐kun are a girl and boy of about the same age. That'd sure be a shame if we walked in on them at a bad tiiime, is what I'd have joked about normally, I'm sure.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica and Kanon-kun were a boy and a girl of about the same age. That'd sure be a shame if we walked in on them at a bad ti-me, or at least that's what we would be joking about normally.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香と嘉音くんは歳の近い男女だ。お邪魔しちゃ悪いタイミングだったら気の毒だよなー、なんて軽口は普段ならきっと叩いていたと思う。
Russian (RU): Джессика и Канон‐кун были девушкой и парнем примерно одного возраста. Будет крайне неловко, застань мы их в неподходящее время. Ну, по крайней мере, так бы мы шутили при обычных обстоятельствах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Jessica e o Kanon‐kun são um garoto e uma garota da mesma idade. Eles certamente vão ficar envergonhados se chegarmos na hora erraaaada, é o que eu normalmente estaria dizendo, tenho certeza.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香和嘉音君是年紀相仿的男女。如果是平時，我一定會打趣說：“要是正好碰上不該打擾的時候，那可就對不起他們了吶——”
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香和嘉音君是年纪相仿的男女。如果是平时，我一定会打趣说：“要是正好碰上不该打扰的时候，那可就对不起他们了呐——”
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Jessica e Kanon-kun sono un ragazzo e una ragazza più o meno della stessa età. Sarebbe stato di sicuro un peccato se ci fossimo intromessi in un momento sbagliato, o almeno era quello su cui avremmo scherzato normalmente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Jessica e Kanon-kun erano dei ragazzi coetanei. Normalmente, avrei senz'altro fatto una battuta scema su come sarebbe stato spiacevole disturbarli in un momento inopportuno.
Turkish (TR): Jessica ve Kanon-kun yaklaşık aynı yaşlarda olan bir kız ve erkek. Kötü bir zamanda onları basarsak çok yazık olur, eminim normal şartlarda bu konuyla dalga geçerdim.

Steam (ST): However, Aunt Rosa was on edge, constantly exuding a sense of tension. ...So it definitely wasn't the sort of atmosphere for careless remarks like that.
Umineko Project (UP): However, Auntie Rosa was on edge, constantly exuding tension. ...So it really wasn't the kind of atmosphere where I could joke like that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Rosa oba-san was on edge, constantly overflowing with a sense of tension....So it really wasn't the kind of atmosphere where we could joke like that.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、楼座叔母さんはぴりぴりしていて、緊張感を常に剥き出しにしていた。…なので、とてもそんな軽口を叩ける雰囲気ではなかったのだ。
Russian (RU): Однако тётя Роза была на взводе и вся переполнена напряжением. ...Так что сложившаяся обстановка не располагала к подобным шуткам.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, a tia Rosa estava no limite, constantemente exsudando tensão. ...Então realmente não é o melhor momento para fazer piadas como essa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，樓座姑母戰戰兢兢的，緊張感在一刻不停地往外冒。…因此在這氣氛下，是怎麼都沒法把打趣的話說出口的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，楼座姑母战战兢兢的，紧张感在一刻不停地往外冒。…因此在这气氛下，是怎么都没法把打趣的话说出口的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, Rosa oba-san era al limite, costantemente straripante di un senso di tensione. ... Quindi non era davvero il tipo di atmosfera in cui si poteva scherzare in maniera simile.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, zia Rosa era molto inquieta, ed emanava costantemente un'aura di tensione... Quindi non c'era affatto l'atmosfera per potersene uscire con simili spiritosaggini.
Turkish (TR): Ancak Rosa Teyze çok gergindi ve etrafına sürekli gerginlik yayıyordu. ...Yani böyle şakalar yapabileceğim bir ortam değildi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "Hey, don't fall behind!! Everyone move together! We don't know when or where the culprit might leap out at us, right?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Hey, don't fall behind!! Everyone move together! We don't know when or where the culprit might leap out at us, you know?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hey, don't fall behind!! Everyone move together! We don't know when or where the culprit might leap out at us, right?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ほらっ、遅れないで！！　みんな一緒に行動するの！　犯人はいつどこから飛び掛ってくるかわからないのよ？！」
Russian (RU): "Эй, не отставайте! Все идём одной группой! Мы не знаем, где и когда на нас может напасть преступник, верно?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ei, não fiquem para trás!! Todos devem andar juntos! Não sabemos quando ou onde o culpado pode pular para cima de nós, sabemos?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「喂，別落後了！！大家要一起行動！天知道犯人會在什麼時候，從什麼地方殺出來！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「喂，别落后了！！大家要一起行动！天知道犯人会在什么时候，从什么地方杀出来！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ehi, non rimanete indietro!! Che tutti si spostino assieme! Non sappiamo da dove il colpevole potrebbe saltare fuori, giusto?!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ehi, non restate indietro!! Spostiamoci tutti assieme! Non sappiamo dove o quando il colpevole potrebbe piombare su di noi, o sbaglio?!"
Turkish (TR): "Hey, geride kalmayın!! Herkes birlikte hareket etsin! Suçlunun ne zaman ve nerede karşımıza çıkacağını bilemeyeceğimizi anlamıyor musunuz?"

Steam (ST): ...No, maybe Aunt Rosa's attitude was more appropriate. ...Since Grandfather hadn't come down, Aunt Rosa was our leader.
Umineko Project (UP): ...No, maybe Auntie Rosa's attitude was more appropriate.{n}......Since Grandfather hadn't come down, Auntie Rosa was the leader.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...No, maybe Rosa oba-san's attitude was more appropriate.......Since Grandfather hadn't come down, Rosa oba-san was the leader.
PC Japanese (JP): …いや、楼座叔母さんの態度の方が正しいのかもしれない。……祖父さまが降りてこない以上、楼座叔母さんがリーダーなのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …いや、楼座叔母さんの態度の方が正しいのかもしれない。{n}……祖父さまが降りてこない以上、楼座叔母さんがリーダーなのだ。
Russian (RU): ...Нет, скорее всего, настроение тёти Розы было самым подходящим для данной ситуации.{n}......Поскольку дедушка так и не спустился, тётя Роза возглавила шествие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Não, talvez a atitude da tia Rosa fosse a mais apropriada.{n}......Como o vovô não apareceu, a tia Rosa é a líder.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …或許，樓座姑母採取的態度是非常正確的。{n}……只要爺爺不從樓上下來，樓座姑母就是我們的頭兒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …或许，楼座姑母采取的态度是非常正确的。{n}……只要爷爷不从楼上下来，楼座姑母就是我们的头儿。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... No, forse il comportamento di Rosa oba-san era quello più appropriato. ... Dato che il Nonno non era sceso giù, Rosa oba-san era il capo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...No, forse era più appropriato l'atteggiamento di zia Rosa...{n}Visto che il nonno non era sceso giù, era zia Rosa a capeggiarci.
Turkish (TR): ...Hayır, belki de Rosa Teyze'nin tavrı çok yerindeydi.{n}......Büyükbaba gelmediği için lider Rosa Teyze'ydi.

Steam (ST): This wasn't a situation where she could smile like she always did.
Umineko Project (UP): This wasn't a situation where she could smile like she always did.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This wasn't a situation where she could smile like she always did.
PC Japanese (JP): いつものように、微笑んでいればいいような事態ではない。
Russian (RU): Это не было ситуацией, где бы она могла улыбаться в своей обычной манере.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Essa não é uma situação onde ela possa ficar sorrindo como sempre faz.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 現在可不是能像往常那樣陪笑臉的事態。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 现在可不是能像往常那样陪笑脸的事态。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questa non era la situazione dove poteva sorridere come faceva sempre.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Questa non era una situazione in cui poteva sorridere come faceva sempre...
Turkish (TR): Bu, her zaman gülümsediği gibi gülümseyebileceği bir durum değildi.

Steam (ST): ...And Aunt Rosa was a mother too. She probably also thought that, if she didn't get ahold of herself, some harm might befall her beloved daughter.
Umineko Project (UP): ......And Auntie Rosa was herself a mother. She probably also thought that, if she didn't get ahold of herself, some harm might befall her beloved daughter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And Rosa oba-san was herself a mother. She probably also thought that, if she didn't get a hold of herself, some harm might befall her beloved daughter.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それに、楼座叔母さんだって母親なのだ。自分がしっかりしなければ、愛娘に危害が及ぶかもしれないという思いもあるのだろう。
Russian (RU): ......И ещё тётя Роза сама была матерью. Она, наверное, думала, что если не возьмет себя в руки, то её любимой дочери может быть причинен вред.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E a tia Rosa também é mãe. Ela provavelmente também pensou que, se ela não se manter firme, alguma coisa poderia acontecer com a sua amada filha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而且，樓座姑母也是母親。她也有想過，如果自己不振作起來的話，愛女或許就會有危險吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而且，楼座姑母也是母亲。她也有想过，如果自己不振作起来的话，爱女或许就会有危险吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... E Rosa oba-san stessa è una Madre. Probabilmente ha anche pensato che, se non si fosse data una calmata, sarebbe potuto accadere qualcosa a sua figlia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E per giunta, zia Rosa era anche una madre. Probabilmente avrà anche pensato che se non si fosse calmata, sarebbe potuto accadere qualcosa alla sua amata figlia.
Turkish (TR): ......Ve Rosa Teyze'nin kendisi de bir anneydi. Muhtemelen o da kendini toparlayamazsa sevgili kızının başına bir şey gelebileceğini düşünüyordu.

Steam (ST): The culprit had killed six of our parents at once. ...The method they had used was unknown, but there was a good chance this opponent could take down a large number of people in a flash.
Umineko Project (UP): The culprit had killed six of our parents at once.{n}......The method they had used was unknown, but there was a good chance that this opponent could take down a large number of people in an instant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The culprit had killed six of our parents at once.......The method they had used was unknown, but there was a good chance that this opponent could take down a large number of people in an instant.
PC Japanese (JP): 犯人は親父たちを６人も一度に殺してる。……どうやって殺したのかは不明だが、それだけの大量殺人を瞬時にやってのける恐ろしい相手である可能性は高い。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 犯人は親父たちを６人も一度に殺してる。{n}……どうやって殺したのかは不明だが、それだけの大量殺人を瞬時にやってのける恐ろしい相手である可能性は高い。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...He's nowhere!! Could the culprit have taken him out of the room?! Then we'll have to search for him quickly and save him! ...If we're slow, something awful might happen!!
Umineko Project (UP): "......He's nowhere!! Could the culprit have taken him out of the room?! Then we have to search for him quickly and save him! ......If we're slow, something awful might happen!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......He's nowhere!! Could the culprit have taken him out of the room?! Then we have to search for him quickly and save him! ......If we're slow, something awful might happen!!
PC Japanese (JP): 「……どこにもないぜ！！　まさか犯人に連れ出されたか？！　なら早く探し出して助けないと！　……もたもたしてるとヤバいことになるかもしれねぇぞ！！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……どこにもないぜ！！　まさか犯人に連れ出されたか？！　なら早く探し出して助けないと！　……もたもたしてるとヤバいことになるかもしれねぇぞ！！」
Russian (RU): "......Его нигде нет! Может быть, преступник уволок его из комнаты?! Тогда мы должны как можно скорее найти и спасти его! ......Если промедлим, то может случиться нечто ужасное!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Não está em lugar nenhum!! Será que o culpado levou ele para outro quarto?! Então temos que procurá‐lo rápido e salvá‐lo! ......Se formos lentos demais, algo horrível pode acabar acontecendo!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……哪兒都沒有啊！！難道是被犯人帶走了？！那得快去找到他們，救他出來啊！……再磨蹭下去搞不好就危險了！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……哪儿都没有啊！！难道是被犯人带走了？！那得快去找到他们，救他出来啊！……再磨蹭下去搞不好就危险了！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Non è da nessuna parte!! Il colpevole potrebbe averlo portato fuori dalla stanza?! Allora dobbiamo cercarlo in fretta e salvarlo! ... Se siamo lenti, potrebbe accadere qualcosa di terribile!!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Non è da nessuna parte!! E se il colpevole lo avesse portato fuori di qui?! Se è così, dobbiamo subito ritrovarlo e salvarlo...! Se non ci diamo una mossa potrebbe accadere qualcosa di brutto!!"
Turkish (TR): "......Burada değil!! Suçlu onu odadan çıkarmış olabilir mi?! O hâlde onu hemen arayıp kurtarmalıyız! ......Eğer hızlı davranmazsak, korkunç bir şey yaşanabilir!!"

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "...Umm, ......Milady wasn't in the habit of locking her room. It seems she would only do it when she went to school, because she didn't want someone like Krauss-sama to look inside her room..."

PC Japanese (JP): 「…あの、…………お嬢様はご自分の部屋に施錠される習慣はあまりありませんでした。ただ、学校に行かれる時だけは、旦那様などに勝手に部屋を見られたくないと言って施錠されていたようですが…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…あの、…………お嬢様はご自分の部屋に施錠される習慣はあまりありませんでした。ただ、学校に行かれる時だけは、旦那様などに勝手に部屋を見られたくないと言って施錠されていたようですが…」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "Because she didn't have a master key, the 19th person, the guest {f:5:Beatrice}, is removed from suspicion for the murder of Jessica-chan alone. But we cannot conclude that she's unrelated to the crime.
Umineko Project (UP): "For the simple reason that our guest wasn't holding a master key, for the murder of Jessica‐chan, and this murder alone, we removed our 19th person—{f:5:Beatrice}—from suspicion. But we can't say that she is unrelated to the crime."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Because she wasn't holding a master key, the 19th person, the guest Beatrice, is removed from suspicion only for the murder of Jessica-chan. But we cannot say that she is unrelated to the crime.
PC Japanese (JP): 「マスターキーを持っていないという理由で、朱志香ちゃん殺しについてだけは１９人目の来客、ベアトリーチェを容疑者から外した。でも、事件に関わってないとは言えないわ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「マスターキーを持っていないという理由で、朱志香ちゃん殺しについてだけは１９人目の来客、ベアトリーチェを容疑者から外した。でも、事件に関わってないとは言えないわ」
Russian (RU): "Из‐за того, что у неё не было универсального ключа, 19‐й человек — гостья {f:5:Беатриче}, исключается из списка подозреваемых по делу Джессики‐чан. Но мы не можем утверждать, что она не причастна к остальным убийствам."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Pelo simples motivo de que o nossa convidada não está portando uma chave mestra, para o assassinato da Jessica‐chan, e apenas para este crime, nós descartamos as suspeitas sobre a 19ª — a {f:5:Beatrice} — mas não podemos dizer que ela não está relacionada com o crime."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我們以“沒有總鑰匙”這一理由，僅在殺害朱志香的案件上，將身為第十九人的來客——貝阿朵莉切從嫌疑人名單中排除了。不過，卻也並不能說她與事件無關。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我们以“没有总钥匙”这一理由，仅在杀害朱志香的案件上，将身为第十九人的来客——贝阿朵莉切从嫌疑人名单中排除了。不过，却也并不能说她与事件无关。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Visto che non era in possesso di un passepartout, la diciannovesima persona, l'ospite Beatrice, è rimossa dai sospetti soltanto per l'omicidio di Jessica-chan. Ma non possiamo dire che sia estranea al crimine.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Visto che la 19ª persona non era in possesso di un passepartout, rimuoveremo l'ospite {f:5:Beatrice} dall'elenco dei sospetti, solamente in merito all'omicidio di Jessica-chan. Ma non possiamo dire che sia estranea al delitto..."
Turkish (TR): "Misafirimizin elinde master anahtar olmaması gibi basit bir nedenden dolayı, yalnızca bu Jessica-chan cinayeti için 19. kişiyi—{f:5:Beatrice}'i—şüpheli listesinden çıkardık. Ama suçla ilgisi olmadığını söyleyemeyiz."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): ...After all, it's a vast amount of gold we're talking about. We can't deny the possibility that there are multiple culprits. ...Right now, one of the people here among us might have been bought by the culprit!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "......After all, it's a vast amount of gold we're talking about. We can't deny the possibility that there are multiple culprits. ......Right now, one of the people here among us might have been bought by the culprit!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......After all, it's a vast amount of gold we're talking about. We can't deny the possibility that there are multiple culprits. ......Right now, one of the people here among us might have been bought by the culprit!!"
PC Japanese (JP): ……何しろ、莫大な黄金ですもの。犯人は複数人いる可能性だって否定できない。……今この瞬間、この中に犯人に買収されている人間が混じっているかもしれない！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……何しろ、莫大な黄金ですもの。犯人は複数人いる可能性だって否定できない。……今この瞬間、この中に犯人に買収されている人間が混じっているかもしれない！！」
Russian (RU): "......В конце концов, мы с вами говорим об огромной горе золота. Мы не можем отрицать вероятность существования нескольких преступников. ......И прямо сейчас среди нас может находиться кто‐то подкупленный преступником!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Afinal, estamos falando de uma vasta quantia de ouro aqui. Nós não podemos negar a possibilidade de que existam múltiplos culpados. ......Agora, uma das pessoas que está entre nós deve estar trabalhando junto com o culpado!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……畢竟，那可是巨額的黃金啊。有多名犯人的可能性也是無法否定的。……在這一瞬間，我們之中說不定就有人已經被犯人收買了！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……毕竟，那可是巨额的黄金啊。有多名犯人的可能性也是无法否定的。……在这一瞬间，我们之中说不定就有人已经被犯人收买了！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Dopotutto, stiamo parlando di una grande quantità d'oro. Non possiamo negare la possibilità che ci siano più colpevoli. ... Proprio ora, uno di noi potrebbe essere stato comprato dal colpevole!!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Dopotutto, stiamo parlando di un'ingente quantità d'oro. Non possiamo negare la possibilità che ci sia più di un colpevole... Allo stato attuale, tra di noi potrebbe esserci qualcuno che è stato comprato dal responsabile!!"
Turkish (TR): "......Ne de olsa büyük miktarda altından bahsediyoruz. Suçluların birden fazla olabileceği ihtimalini görmezden gelemeyiz. ......Şu anda aramızdaki insanlardan biri suçlu tarafından satın alınmış olabilir!!"

Steam (ST): As Aunt Rosa yelled, she looked all around, her gun still raised.
Umineko Project (UP): As Auntie Rosa yelled, she looked all around, her gun still raised.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Rosa oba-san yelled, she looked all around, her gun still raised.

Russian (RU): Тётя Роза кричала, осматриваясь по сторонам со всё ещё поднятым ружьём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que a tia Rosa gritou, ela olhou em volta, ainda com a arma levantada.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "There are only two ways you can be sure someone isn't a suspect. ......If it's yourself, or if they're already no more than a corpse. ......The same goes for Kanon-kun."
Umineko Project (UP): "There are only two groups of people you can be sure aren't suspects. .........Yourself, and those who are already corpses. .........The same goes for Kanon‐kun."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "There are only two ways you can be sure someone isn't a suspect. .........If it's yourself, or if they're already no more than a corpse. .........The same goes for Kanon-kun."
PC Japanese (JP): 「容疑者でないと信じることができるのは２つしかない。………自分自身と、そして死体になった者だけよ。………それは嘉音くんも同じ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「容疑者でないと信じることができるのは２つしかない。………自分自身と、そして死体になった者だけよ。………それは嘉音くんも同じ」
Russian (RU): "Считать кого‐то невиновным можно только в двух случаях. .........Если это ты сам и если тот, кого ты подозреваешь уже является бездыханным трупом. .........Это распространяется и на Канон‐куна."

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「能去相信不是嫌疑人的，就只有兩種人。………一種是自己，還有一種就是已經成為了屍體的人。………這對嘉音君來說也是一樣。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「能去相信不是嫌疑人的，就只有两种人。………一种是自己，还有一种就是已经成为了尸体的人。………这对嘉音君来说也是一样。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Esistono solo due modi per essere sicuri che qualcuno non sia sospetto. {n}Nel caso di se stessi, o nel caso che la persona non sia ormai altro che un cadavere. ... Lo stesso vale per Kanon-kun."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Si può credere all'innocenza di due soli tipi di persone... Se stessi, e coloro che sono diventati dei cadaveri... Lo stesso vale per Kanon-kun."
Turkish (TR): "Şüpheli olmadığından emin olabileceğiniz sadece iki grup insan var. .........Kendiniz, ve çoktan ölmüş olanlar. .........Aynısı Kanon-kun için de geçerli."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "Until we catch sight of his corpse, he is the most likely suspect in Jessica-chan's murder!! So take care. Even if he's still alive, even if he smoothes things over with some explanation, you definitely mustn't trust him! Got it?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Until we catch sight of his corpse, he is the most likely suspect in Jessica‐chan's murder!! So take care. Even if he's still alive, even if he smooths things over with some explanation, you absolutely must not trust him! Alright?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Until we catch sight of his corpse, he is the most likely suspect in Jessica-chan's murder!! So take care. Even if he's still alive, even if he smoothes things over with some explanation, you definitely must not trust him! Alright?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「死体が見付からない限り、彼は朱志香ちゃん殺しの最有力容疑者なのよ！！　だから用心して。もし生きてたとしても、何かの理由を取り繕っても、絶対に信用しちゃ駄目よ！　いいわね？！」
Russian (RU): "Пока мы собственными глазами не увидим его труп, то он является наиболее возможным кандидатом на роль убийцы Джессики‐чан! Поэтому будьте бдительны. Даже если он всё ещё жив, даже если он станет успокаивать вас своими объяснениями, вы совершенно точно не должны доверять ему! Ясно?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Até que nos deparemos com seu cadáver, ele é o suspeito mais provável do assassinato da Jessica‐chan!! Então tomem cuidado. Mesmo que ele ainda esteja vivo, mesmo que ele alivie as coisas com alguma explicação, vocês absolutamente não devem acreditar nele! Entenderam?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「只要還沒找到屍體，他就是殺害朱志香的最大嫌疑人！！所以小心著點。即便他還活著，無論他以什麼理由搪塞遮掩，都絕對不可以去相信！懂了沒？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「只要还没找到尸体，他就是杀害朱志香的最大嫌疑人！！所以小心着点。即便他还活着，无论他以什么理由搪塞遮掩，都绝对不可以去相信！懂了没？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Finché non riusciamo a trovare il suo corpo, è il principale indiziato per l'omicidio di Jessica-chan!! Quindi fate attenzione. Anche se fosse ancora vivo, anche se calmasse le cose con qualche spiegazione, non dovrete assolutamente fidarvi! D'accordo?!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Finché non troveremo il suo corpo, lui sarà il principale indiziato per l'omicidio di Jessica-chan!! Perciò fate attenzione. Anche se fosse ancora vivo, anche se se ne uscisse fuori con una spiegazione, non dovrete assolutamente fidarvi di lui! D'accordo?!"
Turkish (TR): "Biz onun cesedini görene kadar, Jessica-chan'ın cinayetindeki en olası şüpheli o!! Bu yüzden dikkatli olun. Hâlâ hayatta olsa bile, bir açıklamayla işleri yoluna koyacak olsa bile, ona kesinlikle güvenmemelisiniz! Anlaşıldı mı?!"

Steam (ST): No one gave an answer of their own initiative. ...However, those who met Aunt Rosa's eyes had to nod their heads...

Original Witch Hunt (OG): No one gave a answer of their own initiative.......However, those who met Rosa oba-san's eyes had to nod their heads...
PC Japanese (JP): 積極的に返事をした者はいない。……しかし、楼座叔母さんと目が合った者は、頷かざるを得なかった…。
Russian (RU): Никто не дал ответ по собственной инициативе. ......Однако те, кто встречались взглядом с тётей Розой, были вынуждены кивнуть в ответ...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ninguém respondeu por iniciativa própria. ......Porém, aqueles que encontraram com os olhos da tia Rosa concordaram com a cabeça...

Steam (ST): Humans are beings who live by molding themselves to fit society. ...In other words, from the time they're born, trusting each other is genetically imprinted on them.

PC Japanese (JP): 人間ってのは社会を形成して生きる生き物だ。……つまりそれは、生まれながらに信じあうことが遺伝子に刷り込まれてるってことだ。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...But if they had to suspect someone, ...they thought that choosing one of the people not here right now would be the safest.
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、それでも誰かを疑わなくてはならないなら、…今この場にいない人間を選ぶのが、一番無難だと思った。

Steam (ST): For the purpose of safety and nothing more, they half-heartedly chose Kanon to be the sacrifice.
Umineko Project (UP): For just the reason of acceptability, they had passively chosen to sacrifice Kanon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For just the reason of safety, they half-heartedly chose Kanon to be the sacrifice.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas por motivo de aceitabilidade, eles passivamente escolheram sacrificar Kanon.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 仅仅因为“不会使自己为难”这一个理由，我们就消极地，把嘉音选为了牺牲品。

Steam (ST): I'd heard it from George-aniki just now, but not only were those two close in age, they also had that kind of adolescent relationship Aunt Rosa had mentioned.
Umineko Project (UP): I'd only just heard it from George‐aniki, but not only were those two close in age, they also had that adolescent relationship Auntie Rosa had mentioned.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'd heard it from George-aniki just now, but not only were those two close in age, they also had that adolescent relationship Rosa oba-san had mentioned.
PC Japanese (JP): ついさっき、譲治の兄貴に聞いたが、あの二人は歳が近かったこともあり、楼座叔母さんの指摘していたような思春期的な関係があったという。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在刚才，我还问了下让治大哥。可能也是由于两人年岁相近吧——据说，就如楼座姑母所指出的那样，他们两人之间是有着青涩的关系的。

Steam (ST): After seeing her parents' tragic corpses, Jessica, bearing deep wounds in her heart, would only have trusted Kanon-kun.
Umineko Project (UP): After seeing her parents' tragic bodies, Jessica, bearing deep wounds in her heart, would only have trusted Kanon‐kun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After seeing her parent's tragic corpses, Jessica, bearing deep wounds in her heart, would only have trusted Kanon-kun.
PC Japanese (JP): 両親の無惨な遺体を見て、心に深い心を負った朱志香が、嘉音くんにだけは心を許した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 両親の無惨な遺体を見て、心に深い傷を負った朱志香が、嘉音くんにだけは心を許した。
Russian (RU): Увидев трагичные тела своих родителей, Джессика, переживая сильнейшие душевные муки, стала бы доверять только Канон‐куну.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após ver o trágico estado dos corpos de seus pais, a Jessica, com uma profunda ferida em seu coração, podia confiar apenas no Kanon‐kun.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …それはとても考えられる話だ。{n}だから、気に入らない…！！

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 唯一心を許せたのが嘉音くんだった。{n}だから、嘉音くんしか部屋に入れなかった。
Russian (RU): Канон‐кун был единственным, кому она доверяла.{n}Так что она бы не впустила в свою комнату никого, кроме Канон‐куна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Kanon‐kun era o único em quem ela confiava.{n}Por isso ela não deixaria ninguém além dele entrar.

Steam (ST): So, Kanon-kun was the only one who could've killed Jessica? ...I just can't accept that kind of argument...!!!
Umineko Project (UP): So he was the only one who could have killed Jessica. ......I just can't accept that line of argument......!!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, this argument saying Kanon-kun was the only one who could have killed Jessica, ......I just couldn't accept it......!!!

Russian (RU): Поэтому аргумент, что Канон‐кун был единственным, кто мог убить Джессику... Я просто не могу принять его!!!

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也正是因為這樣，所以只有嘉音君才能殺死朱志香，……這種邏輯，我無論如何都無法接受……！！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也正是因为这样，所以只有嘉音君才能杀死朱志香，……这种逻辑，我无论如何都无法接受……！！！

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "...Understand?! Even if Kanon-kun appears, don't let your guards down! As long as we cannot prove Kanon-kun's innocence, we will assume that Kanon-kun is the culprit who killed Jessica-chan!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "...Understand?! Even if Kanon‐kun appears, don't get careless! As long as we cannot prove Kanon‐kun's innocence, we will suppose that Kanon‐kun is the culprit who killed Jessica‐chan!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Understand?! Even if Kanon-kun appears, don't get careless! As long as we cannot prove Kanon-kun's innocence, we will suppose that Kanon-kun is the culprit who killed Jessica-chan!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…わかったッ？！　嘉音くんがもし現れても油断しないで！　嘉音くんの無実を証明できない限り、私たちは朱志香ちゃん殺しの犯人を、嘉音くんだと仮定します！！」
Russian (RU): "...Вы поняли?! Даже если появится Канон‐кун, то мы не должны терять бдительность! До тех пор, пока мы не можем доказать невиновность Канон‐куна, то будем считать, что он и есть убийца Джессики‐чан!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Entenderam?! Mesmo que o Kanon‐kun apareça, não se descuidem! Enquanto não pudermos provar a inocência do Kanon‐kun, nós vamos supor que ele é o culpado que matou a Jessica‐chan!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…都明白了吧？！即使嘉音君出現了，也不要大意！只要還無法證明嘉音君是無辜的，我們就把殺害朱志香的犯人，假定成是嘉音君了！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…都明白了吧？！即使嘉音君出现了，也不要大意！只要还无法证明嘉音君是无辜的，我们就把杀害朱志香的犯人，假定成是嘉音君了！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Capito?! Anche se comparisse Kanon-kun, non abbassate la guardia! {n}Finché non possiamo provare la sua innocenza, supporremo che Kanon-kun sia il colpevole che ha ucciso Jessica-chan!!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Chiaro?! Anche se Kanon-kun dovesse apparire, non fatevi cogliere impreparati! Finché l'innocenza di Kanon non sarà dimostrabile, supporremo che lui sia colpevole per l'omicidio di Jessica-chan!!"
Turkish (TR): "...Anladınız mı?! Kanon-kun ortaya çıksa bile, dikkatsiz olmayın! Kanon-kun'un masumiyetini kanıtlayamadığımız sürece, Jessica-chan'ı öldüren suçlunun Kanon-kun olduğunu varsayacağız!!"

Steam (ST): That was Aunt Rosa's claim. By using the vague word "assume", ...she managed to convince everyone in the end.
Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Rosa made that claim. By using the ever‐so‐slightly vague word "suppose", ...ultimately, she gave everyone that last little push they needed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa oba-san made that claim. By using the vague word 'suppose', ...in the end, she encouraged everyone.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座叔母さんはそう断言した。仮定という、ほんの少しだけ曖昧な言い方が、…最終的に全員の背中を押した。
Russian (RU): Тётя Роза выдвинула это заявление. Под размытым словом "считать"... В конечном итоге, скрывалось желание подбодрить всех.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Rosa deixou isso claro. Usando uma palavra ligeiramente vaga, "supor", ...por fim, ela deu aquele último empurrão que todos precisavam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座姑母如此下了斷言。“假定”這種稍微有一點點模棱兩可的說法，…最終推了所有人一把。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座姑母如此下了断言。“假定”这种稍微有一点点模棱两可的说法，…最终推了所有人一把。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa oba-san disse così. Usando la vaga parola ‘supporre’... alla fine, ha incoraggiato tutti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Questa fu la dichiarazione proferita da zia Rosa. Usando il termine vagamente ambiguo ‘supporre’... alla fine spronò tutti quanti.
Turkish (TR): Rosa Teyze böyle bir iddiada bulunmuştu. Her seferinde belirsiz bir şekilde "varsayalım" kelimesini kullanarak, ...en nihayetinde herkese ihtiyaç duydukları o son küçük itici gücü verdi.

Steam (ST): Everyone nodded weakly, ......and, with the excuse that they were just assuming it for the time being, ......they "concluded" that Kanon was the culprit who had killed Jessica...
Umineko Project (UP): Everyone nodded weakly, ...............and, under the excuse that they were just temporarily supposing it, .........they {i:concluded} that Kanon was the culprit who had killed Jessica...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Everyone nodded weakly, ............and, under the temporary excuse that they were just supposing it, .........they 'claimed' that Kanon was the culprit who had killed Jessica...
PC Japanese (JP): 一堂は弱々しく頷き、……………朱志香殺しの犯人は嘉音だと、とりあえず仮定という言い訳の名の下に、………“断定”した…。
Russian (RU): Все слабо кивнули, и, пользуясь временным оправданием, что они просто будут так считать........... {i:заявили}, что Канон был преступником, убившим Джессику...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos concordaram levemente, ...............e, sob a desculpa de que eles estavam apenas supondo temporariamente, .........eles {i:concluíram} que Kanon é o culpado que matou Jessica...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 大家一同无精打采地点下了头，……………姑且用名为假定的借口，将杀害朱志香的犯人，………“断定”为了嘉音…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tutti quanti annuirono lievemente... e, con la scusa temporanea che lo stavano solo supponendo... ‘affermarono’ che Kanon fosse il colpevole che aveva ucciso Jessica...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ciascuno di noi annuì lievemente con il capo... e {i:proclamò} che Kanon fosse colpevole per l'omicidio di Jessica... con la scusa che fosse una supposizione temporanea...
Turkish (TR): Herkes zayıf bir şekilde başını salladı, ...............ve sadece geçici olarak varsayımda bulundukları bahanesiyle, .........Jessica'yı öldüren suçlunun Kanon olduğu {i:sonucuna} vardılar...

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "*cackle*cackle*! In the first place, the only victory condition in our game was whether or not you could deny my existence. ...Even though that alone put you at a disadvantage, you've increased the number of victory conditions all by yourself, making your own victory harder...!"

In the first place, the only victory condition in our game regarded whether or not you could deny my existence. ...Even though that alone was a game that put you at a disadvantage, you've increased the number of victory conditions all by yourself, and made your own victory difficult...!"

Перво‐наперво, единственное условие победы в нашей игре заключается в том, удастся или нет тебе опровергнуть моё существование. ...Хоть это и само по себе было игрой, ставящей тебя в невыгодное положение, ты сам увеличил количество условий для победы, затруднив тем самым свою победу!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "*gargalhada*gargalhada*! Em primeiro lugar, existe apenas uma condição de vitória no nosso jogo que considera se você pode ou não negar minha existência. ...Mesmo esse sendo um jogo que sozinho coloca você em desvantagem, você aumentou o número de condições de vitórias você mesmo, e fez a sua vitória ser mais complicada...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呵呵呵呵！汝與妾身的遊戲，本就僅有一個“能或不能否定妾身存在”的勝利條件。…明明僅是如此，就已經是對汝不利的遊戲了，可汝卻還在自說自話地增加勝利條件，讓自己更難獲勝…！」

Anche se quello era un gioco che ti metteva in svantaggio, hai aumentato da solo il numero delle condizioni di vittoria, rendendoti la vittoria più difficile...!"
